Craig Cooley was seated in the club's designated safety area it was an accident that shouldn't have happened

detective Tom peas and crime investigator David Taylor had a tough job to figure out where the bullet that killed tray Cooley came from and to determine if the shooting was accidental or intentional virtually spent two decades as a state trooper was it possible the shooting had something to do with an enemy he possibly made during his tenure

or had the bullet come from outside from one of the outdoor shooting ranges or possibly the nearby railroad tracks where kids had a history of taking shots at the air gun building %HESITATION the biggest problem with this rain or the same what's the size of it it wasn't contained inside a house inside an apartment it was outside the covered several hundred feet the bullet removed from the trace gold would provide some answers and raised new questions

the bullet was small about half an inch long but lethal Larry Fletcher is the firearms expert who conducted the ballistics examination double it was not that damaged %HESITATION the bullet was her %HESITATION Raiden rather remarkable condition this is a forty five caliber bullet after striking a cement wall it is badly mangled especially when compared to the bullet that killed tray Cooley that lack of damage could be telling except for one thing this was not a typical forty five caliber bullet this particular moment is a hand loaded are hand made bullish not a commercial made both in which they can A. and other materials to the lead and make it much harder %HESITATION it can withstand a lot of damage upon impact who makes and uses these types of bullets which cooling you competitive shooters like to

police collected the weapons and ammunition samples from the shooters in the competition when Larry Fletcher examine the bullets used that day on the outside ranges he noticed something else the %HESITATION powder charge %HESITATION which %HESITATION increase the velocity of this particular type of moment basically the shooters use bullets with more gun powder more gun powder means these bullets traveled farther and faster than a regular forty five caliber bullet

Larry Fletcher found the gun that fired the fatal shot at that point I was pretty much convenience a pistol competitor named Dan Smith was using that gun on the day of the competition and he was firing on this outdoor range just behind the ear gun building but Smith told police he couldn't have fired the fatal shot he felt that all his shots had made the target there were no %HESITATION rounds but something just didn't add up the birch Coulee he spent his entire life around guns and won awards for marksmanship and gun safety three new shooting ranges are supposed to be safe accidents aren't supposed to happen it just didn't make sense

police were satisfied the tray Cooley's death was an accident the ballistics reports said the fatal bullet came from a gun fired from an outdoor range during the competition but how the owner of the gun said he didn't miss a shot and the range was designed to contain any Aaron Paul

first there's a barrier between the air gun building in the firing range it's called a berm it's a small mountain after about twelve feet high the burn sits right behind the targets in the event of shooter misses either to the left or right directly above the targets are a series of wooden planks fastened and to end and side by side these are called baffles and are designed to catch bullets fired a little high of the target before they leave the range
then there are two additional sets of baffles one just a few yards in front of the firing line and another called an eyebrow directly over the firing line

can buster is a safety management consultant with years of experience as a shooter and with the special expertise in firing ranges between the eyebrow the baffles in the height of the berm the vast majority of any stray bullet would be stopped thirty years should be the number one priority there rice mad and the cheat

but Julie began a personal crusade to learn the truth he needed to know how a bullet could bypass the range's safety features and killed his only son bush hired attorney Mike Schmidt to find out where or if the safety system had failed Schmidt put together an investigative team Stever when was the first member as an accident reconstruction as his job was to create an exact computerized three dimensional scale model of the year gone building in the firing ranges

using laser technology precision measuring devices and sophisticated computer programs %HESITATION one would also one covered the path of the bullet you wind up starting at unfortunately the the young boy get shot and then working your way backwards police had already identified some important clues the outside wall of the air gun building was riddled with bullet holes from all angles %HESITATION we needed to know exactly which one was the culprit police also found bullet holes inside the building in a sheet rock strip to protect the lighting fixture and in a wall that separated the indoor range from a storage shed there was also a fresh downloads in an ordinary ceiling tiles %HESITATION wins laser survey equipment traced the bullet's path from where trade was sitting through all those points from Trey through the sheet rock strip off the ceiling tile and through the back wall it seemed unlikely but it match the evidence was roughly a straight line but I couldn't see from the interior wall to the exterior wall
and it wasn't until we got it back to the office and got it mapped to that
that form this remarkably straight line a straight line that led directly to one of the bullet holes in the aluminum siding then down to the shooting range behind the air gun building

it led to the range where Dan Smith was shooting but oddly enough not to the firing line the laser pinpointed the path that landed ten yards in front of the firing line when can buster was brought into the investigation he immediately inspected the firing range to see if there was any way a bullet could get past all of the Rangers safety features buster delivered a scathing report at the time and now I still think that was the worst range that I have ever seen he found dozens of potentially deadly safety flaws the berm separating the back range from the front range was not the standard height which is supposed to be twenty feet the berm behind the ear gun building was only twelve feet high the baffles were far below standard the wooden planks should had a steel or concrete backing

and look closely at the planks themselves they had separated leaving big gaps a bullet could easily pass through in this case the baffle might well have not have been there and serve no purpose at all and buster was appalled by the bullet holes in the back of the building several of these holes had been plugged that means to me as a safety person as a range person as a long time shooter that they knew that bullets were getting out of that range and they accepted that fact and continue to shoot the laser analysis projected the bullet path to the middle of the outdoor range well in front of the firing line how could this be it was due to a monumental blunder

during the competition shooters were required to fire from several distances first from the firing line at twenty five yards then they moved forward to twenty yards and finally to fifteen yards the laser study showed that the fatal bullet was fired from the fifteen yard line

the architectural model shows the problem clearly by firing from the fifteen yard line shooters had to move in front of the eyebrow and the first set of protective baffles and Erwin's computer also showed another frightening reality from the fifteen yard line you could see the back of the air gun building if you can see it you can shoot and any projectile that might leave
the range in that area was going to hit that building the laser show the bullet flew under the last baffled over the berm and into the building

it involved a bizarre trajectory it meant that the shooter missed the target high and to the left by more than five feet a terrible mess how could a trained marksman missed a target by that much from only fifteen yards away part of that answer was found in the gun itself close examination revealed it had been modified it's like taking a standard car making a hot rod some competitive shooters file down parts of the gun to make it easier to pull the trigger quickly they've got it set to where is it they go off so easily with the fire two rounds instead of want to feed so fast the result is called doubling which sometimes occurs as the gun recoils a recall oil is the backward force created by the explosion pushing the gun up in the air

each type of gun recoils differently a forty five creates a recall up into the left Kirk parks had the task of producing the computerized proof of fact based animation of what happened his firm specializes in forensic animation

mark's video taped hundreds of forty five caliber pistol shots using the same type pistol and ammunition he used this footage to create an exact computerized reproduction of the recall oil for the animation I we shot the video from the top of the weapon was shot from the side and we shot it from the front

next parks created wire frame models of a competitive shooter in action and then animated %HESITATION wins laser studies of the firing range and the bullet path to complete the picture it produced the exact results necessary to generate the bullet path survey up and to the left I can't say for sure that the gun doubled but all of the evidence seems to indicate that it did and it fired during the uncontrollable recall this forensic animation was able to show what happened to trade Cooley on the morning of September twenty ninth nineteen ninety one but the animation show that the bullet took a remarkable journey one which almost defied belief

when Trey coolly enter the Dallas pistol and revolver club on September twenty ninth nineteen ninety one the range was a tragedy just waiting to strike outside on the firing range behind the year gone building Dan Smith one of the last competitors of the day steps up to the fifteen yard line this moves hand in front of two sets of safety baffles using a modified gun Smith takes aim and squeezes the trigger
in a fraction of a second another shot is fired during the recall oil phase of the original shot it happened so quickly the shooter doesn't know which left the gun

the bullet misses the target hi and to the left traveling upwards it passes underneath the last set of protective baffles and just three inches over the burn it speeding at twelve hundred feet per second the bullet blasts through the aluminum siding goes through a storage room this is a broom and some pipes by less than an inch and then breaks through a second ball entering the air gun range then the bullet does something unbelievable it strikes an ordinary ceiling tile and for some unknown reason it doesn't blast straight through into the roof instead it skids along the tile for seven inches before mysteriously changing direction making a ten degree turn and begins a downward path it slows to about nine hundred feet per second penetrates a plaster wall

and enters trade police have the Cooley family filed a negligence suit against the gun club and individuals involved with the competition the judge who presided over the civil case was impressed with the visual and computerized evidence I've been on the bench six and a half years and I would say that's in the the top %HESITATION two or three or four %HESITATION in terms of just the the professionalism and the effectiveness of of the %HESITATION demonstrative evidence brought into court the Cooley's attorney says the forensic animation and model explained this tragedy in a way nothing else could I could not have possibly gotten the results that I got on behalf of the Cooley family without the animation also help birch Coulee understand what had happened to his son but there is still little piece for trays dad which brings
